Nerangs.ab: yasnəmca tā āfrīnāmī sraōšahe tā āhūiriiehe ka xšnūman srōš bēd wāz srōš bē nē gōwišn
"(They should say) from yasnəmca until āfrīnāmī sraošahe and until āhūiriiehe. When it is the šnūman for Srōš, then they have not to recite the wāz srōš."
yasnəmca ... āfrīnāmī sraōšahe. ... āhūiriiehe. agar šnūman srōš bēd yatāhuwairyō dō yasnəmca. tā sar wāz srōš bē nē gōwišn
"yasnəmca ... āfrīnāmī sraōšahe. ... āhūiriiehe. If the šnūman is not for Srōš, they should rectire two Ahuna Vairiia, the yasnəmca until the end, but they do not have to say the wāz srōš."

Ritual.ab: Cf. N4.3 (cf. Kotwal and Kreyenbroek, 1995: pp. 44-45):
ka zōt srōš srūd srōšāwarz ul ō pāy estēd ka ātaxš ī warhrān ān gyāg [[pad]] pas abāz nē hilišn pad ēn tis zōt srōšāwarz
"When the zōt has recited the Srōš (Yašt), the srōšāwarz rises to his feet. If there is there an Ātaxš Wahrhrām, he should not abandon (this position) again. In this case, the zōt is the srōšāwarz."
